Matías Richart

Instituto de Computación · Facultad de Ingeniería · Universidad de la República · mrichart@fing.edu.uy

I'm currently an Assistant Professor (Profesor Adjunto) at University of the Republic in Uruguay. I received my Computer Engineer and Master degrees from the University of the Republic in 2011 and 2014 respectively and my Ph.D. from University of the Republic and from Polytechnic University of Catalonia (Spain) in 2019.

My research focuses on the autonomous control and management of wireless networks through stochastic optimization and machine learning techniques. I'm also have vast experience in wireless network simulations with practical experience in the utilization and development of the NS-3 Simulator. I have also worked with policy-based management of networks and with opportunistic wireless networks by collaborating in several research projects.

I'm proud to be part of the MINA research group. You can find more details of my carreer at SNI-CVuy and a complete list of my publications at my Google Scholar profile.

Universidad de la República - PEDECIBA - Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya

Ph.D. in Computer Science

Double degree of Ph.D. in Computer Science (Doctor en Informática) and Ph.D. in Network Engineering (Doctor en Telemática). With fellowship from University of the Republic.

Thesis: Resource Allocation and Management Techniques for Network Slicing in WiFi Networks (PDF)

Supervisors: Javier Baliosián, Joan Serrat and Juan-Luis Gorricho

2015 - 2019

Universidad de la República - PEDECIBA

Master in Computer Science (Magister en Informática).

With fellowship from National Agency for Innovation and Research (ANII).
